channel.title: School Network
channel.description:
Hiya,
Summer is around the corner and Ive been bored lately at school and thought it would be funny to mess around with the school network and find some exploits. My school network is more secured then my previous schools.. so Im having a little trouble. Any suggestions?
For people who want to know.. You can shutdown computers by making a shortcut to shutdown -i

item.title: School Network
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:6, topic:338243”]omg nooooo please dont do this! didn’t you hear of the other kid that got banned from school computers for looking at BIOS? OMG[/quote]I see what you did there.

Read full topic

item.title: School Network
item.dc:creator: @lordbost lordbost
item.description:
@lordbost wrote:

Where i work, we have disabled local admin, so you will need the username and password to a domain admin.
And if you unlock the local admin with Hiren’s BootCD, it will only last till next time you login while connected to the school network.
And to be able to use Hiren’s you will need the bios password.

Read full topic

item.title: School Network
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

This ^

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Bunch of people think that getting the local administrator password wont help, it does. Gives you access to servers that are otherwise disallowed to student profiles. Once you’ve got access to those, you can do a lot of stuff, because the student profiles read to certain servers for a lot of stuff(backgrounds etc). You can also use the build in windows remote access tool to shut down the networks that students login to and store stuff on. There’s really a lot of stuff you can do, so I’d recommend getting the local admin password first

Read full topic

item.title: School Network
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

[quote=“Nueb35, post:4, topic:338243”][quote author=Old Rsc Player link=topic=434635.msg3191969#msg3191969 date=1272341939]
Well right now, command prompt is blocked… “disables by administrator” comes up, any advice?
[/quote]

make a batch file, in it :

@echo off command[/quote]

Im pretty positive that still wont work. Ill check it in a hour.

Read full topic
